name: Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld

reviews.text: Being this was a first trip to Orlando for several of the Girl Scouts we traveled with. We wanted a hotel that would offer several amenties for extra activities. WE GOT IT!!!!! The proerty was amazing. The theater inside of the lobby was on time. The 2 day hopper passes we had for Disney the girls didnt want to go a 2nd time, they chose to stay at the pool and enjoy. The fireworks from the hotel and Seaworld were beautiful at night. Great rooms(at the Smiths) just georgous. We cant wait to return and with several additonal guests.
reviews.title: Cant Wait to Return

reviews.text: The property was clean and the grounds were beautiful. I would give this property 5 stars EXCEPT for this one problem....As a guest in a studio style suite my room had a door that would enable it to act as a third bedroom to one of the two bedroom suites. Well, there was little to dampen the noise of the crying children and the aromas of dinner that wafted into my room. It was like being a part of their family since I could hear every word that was said. Every night when they came home from the theme parks with their very tired and whining children they had to eat, watch TV and so forth. The younger kids liked to try to open the door whenever they had the chance and no one stopped them. So there was much yanking and banging on the door which separated us. I would stay at this property again but never in a studio, always in a suite.
reviews.title: Don't stay in the studio style room!

reviews.text: My family stayed at this property for four nights and absolutely loved it. We had a two-bedroom suite and it was gigantic. The rooms are on opposite sides of the living area so plenty of privacy. Housekeeping did a great job; grounds were immaculate. Our sons loved the waterfall pool and the video game room; we didn't really do any of the planned activities for children -- either too busy at the parks or too tired from visiting them! All employees were very professional, friendly and helpful except...
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel for Families

likes.liked: — The spaciousness and cleanliness; the friendly staff.
likes.disliked: — Concierge desk -- too pushy about trying to sell timeshares or attraction tickets.

reviews.text: Our one tiny complaint was that the concierge desk was not terribly helpful if you just needed directions. Before answering questions, they asked for your room number so that they could see if you were already a timeshare owner and if you weren't, they tried to get you to sign up for a sales pitch. No big deal -- we just stopped going to the concierge.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay!!

reviews.text: The HGVC was very nice!! We stayed there from the 5th-9th of Aug. We stayen in the South Hampton Building on the 4th floor, and our room was spotless. The appliances were all clean and in working order. The bathroom shower, and the the tub was spotless. We just loved the inclosed balcony since you could sit out there, and not have to worry about any bugs.
reviews.title: Fantastic Family Vacation!

reviews.text: I didn't actually get a chance to stay here, but I loved the hotel so much I decided to write a review. I came to this hotel with family who were checking in for a week. We arrived around 11 am and they allowed early check in. The rooms were beautiful (and bigger than my apartment). The large kitchen was well appointed with granite countertops. The dining table was perfect for a meal with a family. The best part of the room, though, was probably the jacuzzi tub. We found the staff extremely helpful. The pool is lovely and there is even a pizza hut next to it. The restaurant off of the pool was also great. They have a $7 kids buffet which was perfect- it allowed the kids to choose their food and had healthy options (fruit and veggies) that most restaurant kid's meals don't have. Our waitress was so pleasant. I didn't get to stay here but I really wish I had. Next time we are in Orlando I will try to get the RCI points to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel: Wish I Could Have Stayed

reviews.text: We had a 3 bedroomed 3 bathroomed apartment, in the Devonshire Block. It could not of been better, son, daughter in law had the room with the Jacuzzi, the 2 girls had a bedroom with double bed each and self and wife had a more or less self contained Granny flat. TV in lounge and all bedrooms. The 3 pools were excellent, with towels provided, the grounds were well laid out and spotless, the cinema was ideal for the girls. The staff were helpfull and very friendly The location was ideal all Disney parks within 15 minutes drive, Walmart and I Drive within 15 mins. Would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Better than Home and close to the action
Great stay
reviews.text: Amazing, beautiful location with excellent service! Across the street from Seaworld and minutes away from Disneyworld.
We stayed 2 weeks at this incredible property and I can't say enough good things about it. The staff is wonderful, the place is as clean as can be and the location is excellent.
reviews.title: FIVE STAR PROPERTY IN ALL RESPECTS!

reviews.text: There's nothing better then returning to the same hotel, year after year, and experiencing it getting better with each visit.
reviews.title: HGVC continues to exceed our expectations

reviews.text: A colleague and I booked two rooms to attend a conference in Orlando. We arriving prior to 2:00 p.m. at the hotel desk and was immediately checked in to the Smith's house, the last building (about a 5 minute walk). The hotel grounds were very nice and the staff we encountered were very friendly. We used the I-trolley a couple of times, and that worked out well.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, but Noisy Rooms

reviews.text: The major problem was the noise at night time. We both stayed in a studio room, 1st floor. The walls of these adjoining rooms were so think--I could practically hear the conversations going on next door. Unfortunately, the room next to me contained a family with several screaming and crying kids that went on past 11:00 p.m. The smell of their food also made its way over into my room.
reviews.title: a family delight

reviews.text: My colleague also was wakened several times from the noise of people yelling outside (she was near the elevator).
reviews.title: Very Nice Property

reviews.text: While the grounds were nice and staff was friendly, I would personally not return to this resort just due to the loud noise.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: The hotel is also renovating their main pool, so the entire area is closed off. They had no mention of this on their website, so you may want to check first.
reviews.title: Very nice, great location

reviews.text: will never go again
reviews.title: dont go

reviews.text: my wife and i checked in and maintenance or housekeeping wher in my unit watching tv they jumped up when we walk in its a shame nice place but i wont feel safe
reviews.title: Beautiful property - surprising apartment like

likes.disliked: — Lots of walking to get to the office and snack shop place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned a hotel for business and randomly chose this Hilton .. and it had a good price (around $170). I ended up with a room that was more like an apartment than a hotel room -- full living room, bedroom and kitchen. Washer and dryer. Screened in balcony / porch. Free Internet. Whirlpool tub.
reviews.title: emm ok after we got keys that worked

likes.liked: — the room and the pool area (fun karaoke on thursday and saturday)
likes.disliked: — issue with keys not working 6 hours to get settled.

reviews.text: The property is really, really big, and I had to walk a long ways to the office / club house, which would have been a pain if it had been raining.
reviews.title: Great home away from home

likes.liked: — spacious room, kitchen and washing machine

reviews.text: There is no real restaurant on site, instead they have a small deli and snack shop.
reviews.title: Good Hilton vacation club

reviews.text: My wife, my 15 year old and myself stayed 5 nights over the 4th of July. The place is nice and clean but there is not much to do for a 15 year old and or us, the pools are full of small kids and they just run every where. The place is way to big for 3 small pools and no indoor place to eat but your room. Dont get me wrong the place is best for a family with younger kids, will we stay there again, no, I like smaller places I think you feel better and the places are more freindly, but over all if you have small kids and are looking for the park thing please do stay here.
reviews.title: NICE PLACE FOR KIDS

reviews.text: We stayed at HGVC SeaWorld from July 9 - 14. We had a 1 bdrm suite in the Pembroke Building. It was beautiful! Everything was so clean! We had daily maid service, a washer/dryer, screened patio, and full kitchen! The customer service was excellent as well! We had a ground level room and it was beautiful and close to the pools!
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation!

reviews.text: The pools are great as well! They had plenty of daily activities for the kids and adults as well! We did Casino Nite and Kareoke while our daughter was in the movie theater watching a kids movie with the other kids!
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.text: The pool bar has nice drink service. The food is ok if you want a burger or quick sandwich. The wait staff is very slow at the pool bar so be prepared to wait! The Pizza Hut express was nice as they delivered to the room!
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

likes.disliked: — The flies in the deli and the distance to walk to the main pool.

reviews.text: We only got one call for the timeshare presentation and politely declined and were never called about it again!
reviews.title: Clean, Nice Price & Location but Large Unhealthy Crowd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton by Sea World and overall found the stay quite pleasant.
reviews.title: Overall good standard hotel

reviews.text: Overall a very nice hotel: Very clean & comfortable rooms; beds especially comfortable. I found the staff to be very helpful and promptly responded to any requests we had. The deli on site was handy, but we rarely ate at the hotel so only used this once.
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed in the studio room. All these room types are interconnecting and it is quite easy to hear the neighbor’s. For a few days of our stay we had a screaming child to send us to sleep each night and I have to admit it was a bit of a nightmare, but we survived.
reviews.title: Wow, amazing one bedroom suite!

reviews.text: We found no issues with parking and were regularly in and out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice room, skip the sales talks

reviews.text: We had a small pool at the back of our block and it was very nice, small but always plenty of loungers and towels. Bigger pool at main hotel looked very nice, but lots and lots of children (who all seemed to be having a great time), but we prefer the quite life.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value
Never Again!
reviews.text: I was in Orlando for only one night and wanted to stay somewhere that would provide everything needed to avoid wasting time in the car. I used to live in Florida and spent much time in Orlando. I had recalled this resort, where I had stayed for a few nights about 5 years ago.

The rate was a bargain ($81 AAA) for a queen junior suite. These rooms are configured as an open studio, with a dorm-sized fridge, microwave, sink, and basic kitchen utensils. The queen bed is nearby with either a loveseat or large chaise lounge. A table-for-two is located in a nook. Some of the junior suites include a screened-in balcony, but not all include this feature so ask when booking if it's important to you.
reviews.title: Absolutely Great, No Qualms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is rather expansive and enjoyed by families. Pools include waterfalls. A small store is on site, as are a few dining options. While I didn't travel with a child, it was clear that this resort would be appealing to folks with kids. The resort has an extensive offering of daily activities for kids.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Extremely Spacious, loved the double sinks

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and gracious. I dined at the outdoor restaurant located near one of the pools. My group ordered burgers, turkey wraps, and ribs. Everything was tasty and not exorbitantly priced.
reviews.title: Room was fine but a curious place and not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was clean and adequately maintained. The carpet had several stains, the bathroom was due for an update, and some baseboards were in need of replacement. The bed, however, was comfy. Internet access was reputed to be complimentary, but I was never able to get it to work.
reviews.title: Great place, great staff

likes.liked: — Great apartments, fabulous staff, close to parks and shopping

reviews.title: Great spot but loose management
reviews.text: We Had a group of 16 family members meeting in Orlando, we reserved three rooms. Our room in Sandy's House was ready on time and very clean. The facility was ideal for family reunions.

reviews.title: Great stay with small children
reviews.text: The pool was lovely but the staff must have put clorine in at around 9am because my son saw powdered chemicals around his feet during his morning swim. His swim suite was ruined. Treating the water should be done off peek hours so that children and bather's are not effected by concentrated chemicals.
There was a problem with the door lock which was remedied after two hours and three or four call backs. Including two visits too the front desk.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The refridgerator was not cold at all and after the service person worked on it was still not cold.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Our niece waited over three hours for her room after a very long flight with two small children.
reviews.title: Great Stay! Highly Recommended by 3rd Time Guest

reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom unit. The second bedroom was a self-contained studio, which was great as we were traveling with a friend who could have her own privacy. The two-person jacuzzi tub is a real nice feature. The hotel is very clean, and the service is great. We liked the location because Discovery Cove and Sea World are right next door, and access to Interstate #4 was close by. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our entire stay we were treated like we were special. From the initial checkin all the way to checkout, at every turn we were greeted with a smile and a hello. This was a quick trip and we knew we were not going to be in the hotel much, so I booked a smaller room ($100) full well knowing I was going into a cheaper room in a resort like this, but to my surprise the room was great and all the other actitivies were there for me as well. Without a doubt, I would stay there again and as a matter of fact we are already looking at spring of 2011 for our next trip down!
reviews.title: Treated like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me, my husband and my 24 year old son stayed at the HGVC Sea World last december.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Orlando

reviews.text: We were amazed with the hotel.
reviews.title: Condo was more than expected
Great Choice!
reviews.text: We arrived early and they already had an apartment for us.

Travelling on business, I took advantage of a very low off season rate, fully aware that I was booking at a vacation/resort hotel. No real amenities for a business traveller, but would be awesome for a family vacation. Grounds are stunningly beautiful, room was small but adequate with a kitchenette. Nice restaurant next to a huge resort pool.
reviews.title: Beautiful property - great for family vacation, not for business travellers.

reviews.text: While the reviews previous to mine said the hotel was looking tired, I'm sitting here right now watching all the refurbishments they are doing. The whole main building just got a brand new coat of paint and it looks great! The lobby is in the midst of rennovation at the moment and they tell me it will be done in mid-Dec. Our room is on the ground floor in the Padget House (one of the further buildings away from the main area) however it is beautiful. The kitchen area is great because we went out to Publix down the road and went grocery shopping so we didn't have to eat out every day. The main pool area is very nice. One pool is heated and one is not. There is also shuffleboard, ping-pong, a pool table, kids play area, and kids pools as well as numerous hot tubs. On our first day here, we spent the entire day at the pool and the kids (ages 3 and 8) had a fabulous time. There are many organized activities to keep the kids busy in or out of the pool. The outdoor restaurant is right on the pool deck so it was nice to grab something to eat. We are not vacation club owners. We got a good deal on the hotel over Thanksgiving in exchange for sitting through a 2-hr. vacation club presentation. They stuck to the 2hr. timeframe and when we realized the vacation club membership wasn't for us, they shook our hands, sent us on our way and there was no pressure what-so-ever. This resort is directly across the street from Sea World and about a 15 min. drive from all the Disney theme parks. We went and saw the other Hilton Grand Vacation property today, Parc Soleil, and while it is much, much nicer, it's also brand new compared to this property that is 15 yrs. old. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Kids had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week here in November in a studio on an RCI exchange week. The location is great, 5 minutes walk to Seaworld (you can get a shuttle to acquatica from seaworld entrance). An I Tram stop and a Lynx bus stop just outside the entry gate whoch will take you up and down International drive and to other locations in the area. Resort has shuttles to key attractions but they don't run very often so we did not use them.
reviews.title: Great location, starting to look tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Studio was a good size but starting to show its age, noted that other buildings had been recently refurbished with flat screen TV's etc, suppose you can't do them all at once, but the block we were in (Somerset) needs to have its turn soon as its starting to show its age.
reviews.title: Great Location-average stay

reviews.text: Very limited central services, tiny bar and small restaurant for size of resort, guess people either self cater or eat out. Restaurant food was very mediocre and I would not reccommend it other than for a quick drink. Basic grocery store on site and Pizza take away but you would be better of stocking up at Publix or Wal Mart before you arrive if you have a car.
reviews.title: Not so sure that we would return.
A memorable time!
reviews.text: We have just returned from Grand Vacation Sea World and like most people have had a fantastic time. We stayed in one of the large 3 bedroom units which was perfect. It was in Pembroke building which has been recently renovated and close to the shop, pool and reception. The accomodation was very clean. The pool area could get busy - everybody looked as if they were having a happy time. The staff were lovely - nothing was too much trouble.

Discovery Cove (next door) and Sea World (across the road) are worth a visit as are the Outlet stores and Millenium Mall. We loved The Cheesecake Factory restaurant there - infact we went there 3 times as the meal was excellent value and good choice of food for all - it does not just sell cheesecakes(!) and are sad there is not one in the UK we could visit - it would do really well.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: So we had a lovely time and would recommend HGVC Sea World to anyone. We hope to return.
reviews.title: Fun for the whole family!

reviews.text: Great place to stay , very clean , great for kids , me and my girlfriend stayed here for # nights and it was close to everything you could want. big pools very big rooms . i just dont have a bad thing to say about this place .
reviews.title: Upscale Resort Hotel - We loved it!

reviews.text: My family (myself, husband and 2 daughters - ages 3.5 and 9 months) as well as my sister and parents all went to the Hilton Sea World. The vacation was perfect from start to finish. The rooms were spacious (we had the 2 bedroom suite) and clean. All the amenities you could ask for! There was always something going on for the kids and yet if you didn't want to participate it was not overwhelming in any way. It was minutes away from Sea World and International Drive.
reviews.title: Great resort for the price

reviews.text: This property and room was EXCELLENT and a great value. The room (1 BR) was extremely spacious, the bed and linens were quality and so comfortable. Even the sofa bed was comfy for the kids. Very clean, no sightings of bugs in the room nor on the screened in ground level patio.
reviews.title: A+, Beautiful & Spacious

reviews.text: One small downfall was the internet connection in the room was not working during our 3 day stay and even though my husband spent some time talking on phone to tech support, it did not get fixed. Front desk staff made attempts to help, unsuccessfully, but were sincere in wanting to help.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Nor For Business Meetings

reviews.text: Kids (11 & 14) liked the pools and movie screen at the pool. But this is a huge SAFETY HAZARD as during the movie lighting in pool is very dim (could barely see them) and parents could be distracted with the movie. Good concept, but low lighting, distraction, and kids in a pool do not mix.
reviews.title: Second 1st Impressions Are Possible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit of a walk to the pool area, but lovely grounds. A large golf cart shuttle is available.
reviews.title: Greatest Place Ever

reviews.text: Overall, this was the best property we stayed at during our trip and we would return!
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: We just returned from a trip to Flordia and this was the best place that we stayed. We got an excellent rate on the internet. Our room was wonderful, we had a 1 BR suite and the rooms was great with a porch, big tub, nice appliances with everything we could possibley want for cooking. The house cleaning staff was very nice and did a great job. The desk staff could have been more helpful and informed. We had a light that wasn;t working and we called to complain a couple of times and it never did get fixed but it wasn;t that big of a deal.
reviews.title: Great stay
Loved it here!
reviews.text: They have several buildings to stay in and they put us in one that was further out but it was quite a walk to the center with the toddler pool and playground. We asked to be moved and they moved us so we could be closer to the action. This also put us closer to a building that was having some construction done so it was a little noisy in the day but we were okay with that.

We were there with our 11 mo daughter & it was great for her. We took her to the little pool and playground as well as walking around the grounds and it was great. There are activities going on all day, which is great if you have kids. There were many families with children there and all the guests were very nice. There was more then one pool as well as an adults only pool so people can escape the kids if they wish. We were happy to be around them. The pools are heated and they have a big waterfall that is fun to swim under as well as several jacuzzis.
reviews.title: Very satisfied

reviews.text: The food was okay. We ate from the restaurant several times as the hotel is a bit off the beaten track so we had to drive a little ways to get any food. They could do better with the food and if they did this place would be excellent. We did get food from the grocery store which we cooked in our room as well as breakfasts and that worked out well for us.
reviews.title: A wonderful retreat from all that is Orlando!

reviews.text: They have an onsite store but the food is way overpriced, just drive a few blocks to the grocery store. I have a breakfast wrap from this store and it was not so great and that is the last time I got anything from that store.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to stay at a nice resort without having to go to another country. This was a great find! First off, the property is gated which deters others from 'traveling through' the property. The entire hotel staff was friendly and personalble.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late on a Friday night. The concierge recommended a great "NY Style" pizza joint that delivered. The property was very well kept and clean. The main pool area was georgous with plenty of lounge chairs, even on the busiest day.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: One surprise was the amount of planned activities that the property offers each day. The activities are suitable for adult and children. For example, there is a daily movie shown in their movie theatrie. One night a week the movie is shown at the main pool grounds. They also had 'behind the scenes' trips to Sea World for the kids.... the list goes on and on. For adults, they had a wine and cheese social, beer tasting, 'vegas night' and dance instructer.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Hilton Grand Vacations Sea World

reviews.text: We stayed in a one bedroom villa which was fully equipped with a full kitchen, dining, living, bed and bathroom. The kitchen had all the necessary equiptment including dish soap and StarBucks coffee. Not to mention the washer and dryer and hotel provided Tide.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!

reviews.text: A big benefit to this location is DAILY housekeeping. They clean the villa, will put dirty dishes into the dishwasher and restock the provided amentities such as shampoo (Crabtree & Evelyn), Tide, Starbucks coffee, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from HGVC and we loved it. We stayed 5 nights at this resort.
reviews.title: Great Resort!!!! We could have stayed longer ...

reviews.text: The 2 bedroom villa we stayed in was clean and looked like it had been newly decorated. Maid service came every day - this was great to come back and find the kitchen to be cleaned , bathrooms cleaned. and beds made. They also left coffee and toiletries each day.
reviews.title: Very Nice.
We ENJOYED the HGVC.. at Sea World
reviews.text: The pools were wonderful and so relaxing with the waterfalls. We took advantage of the hot tubs, just wonderful. My son and his girlfriend got a massage and they absolutely loved it. My 15 year old loved to go to the pool area and play pingpong and pool. My husband enjoyed 2 movies at the movie theater and the rest of us took advantage of a movie one rainy night. All of us thoroughly enjoyed this resort. We stayed in the St. George location closer to the pools and main lobby.
Next time we plan on staying longer......
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time

reviews.text: I stayed here while on a business trip in Orlando. I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. I had a 1 bedroom suite and it was awesome! The suite had a full size kitchen (fully equipped) and was bigger than my first apartment! It was very nicely decorated and clean. The enclosed balcony was also an additional plus.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more.....

reviews.text: My family consisted of :one adult and two teenage boys 14. We felt like this hotel facility included everything we need. Our room was very clean and had a welcoming feeling inside. The interior of the room was well up to date and nice. Please take a look at my pictures. I tried to include a lot of pictures since no picture exited before my arrival. The room had a full kitchen with all appliances you could think of. Inside the living room you had a queen pull out sofa with a big screen TV and DVD. Inside the bedroom you had a king size bed with big TV and a jaccuzzi inside the room. There was also a little sink and adjoining bathroom. I like the ideal of looking the adjoining bathroom while I got dress so the boys could have some privacy of there on. On the other side of the bedroom was a patio with table and chairs that was screened in. You could also enter the patio from the living room. The bathroom was a shower only no bathtub if you need one just hop in the jaccuzzi. The only down fall for us was that the pool restaurant/bar didn’t serve that much food which I thought was kind of pricey. There was a main resturant near check in. We never ate there. The pools were hug with about 3 jaccuzzi and 3 pools. One of the pools had a waterfall. Ajoing to the pool was a dock, which you could walkout on and look at the pond. One day we saw turtles and fish. This was a place you could go and relax. During the night you could also observe Sea World fireworks. Please buy your Universal tickets online. If you paid for two day you was awarded with three additional days free of charge. The ticket was only $99.00 for all five days. I think the hotel ticket booth was sealing the tickets for one day at this price. The shuttle system at this hotel was very accommodating. There was time that the night transportation was screwed up otherwise okay. I went on a timeshare presentation, which I enjoyed with the Hilton. Thinking about going back next year to buy some. Please go and visit this hotel you will enjoy yourself. They was very kid friendly my teenager son and his friend played pool everyday. There were also different activities for every age group throughout the day. One night that had a movie at the pool, which we didn’t make. Several ping-pong tables were there as well. Bring you ping-pong balls with you or you can purchase one for 0.25. The Wal-Mart is right off international drive. If you take International drive like you going towards Wet-n-Wild you will make a right at the light near Popeye’s chicken. Continue to go straight and over a bridge about ½ mile you will see Wal-Mart on left. This place saved me tons of money. Go and enjoy Florida!!! We did!!
reviews.title: No Better Place to stay! Kid friendly
Great family hotel in the Orlando area
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World. I am perplexed with some of the negative reviews as we have nothing but praise for this hotel. My husband and I travel often for business and have stayed in all kinds of accomodation. Sure its not the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong or the Park Hyatt Tokyo, but it is a wonderful family oriented hotel with lovely pools, good service, and wonderful rooms.

My sister and her two children (6 and 7 yrs old) and my husband and I with our two children (12 and 14 years old) each had a one bedroom accomodation in the Devonshire building. The rooms were lovely - full kitchens, nice seperate bedroom for the adults, more than acceptable pull out sofa bed for the kids, large bathroom, seperate jacuzzi and screened-in balcony. It was clean and nicely decorated. The rooms had a DVD player with DVDs to rent at the grocery store which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The staff were friendly, always saying hello when you passed them. The pools were clean with plenty of towels. The pool side restaurant was fine, with friendly service. The grocery store also served Starbucks coffee which more than adequately addressed our daily required caffeine fix. The reception staff accomodated our request for the two rooms in the same building. Grounds staff passing in golf carts always stopped to ask if we needed a ride to our building which was a pleasant relief after walking back one evening from Sea World with tired children.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.text: I would have absolutely no hesitation to recommend this hotel to families with children looking for a Orlando theme park vacation/holiday. My 7 yr old niece summed it up when she said "best vacation she ever had".
reviews.title: From Penthouse to Outhouse

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations At Seaworld Hotel
description: A 33-acre Bermuda-styled resort, Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at SeaWorld puts guests in close proximity to Walt Disney World®, Universal Orlando®, Wet 'n Wild® Orlando and - just across the street - SeaWorld® Orlando. Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at SeaWorld offers comfort and convenience for the entire family. Guests enjoy well-appointed studios, one- and two-bedroom suites, as well as several swimming pools, all-ages recreation and on-site restaurants.
